pr_title: GH-1995 push release branch and automate PR creation

timeline.message:
GH-1995 push release branch and automate PR creation

- push release branch to avoid direct commits on master
- use hub command to create PR for release branch to master
- use hub command to create PR for updating develop branch

timeline.bodyText: Isn’t this the branch we are on already?
timeline.author: hmottestad
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -153,7 +165,7 @@ git pull
 
 MVN_VERSION_DEVELOP=$(xmllint --xpath "//*[local-name()='project']/*[local-name()='version']/text()" pom.xml)
 
-git checkout master
+git checkout ${BRANCH}

timeline.bodyText: Can we use the official command line client instead? https://cli.github.com/
timeline.author: hmottestad
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,12 @@ increment_version() {
  echo "$v" | perl -pe s/$rgx.*$'/${1}'`printf %0${#val}s $(($val+1))`/
 }
 
+echo ""
+echo "The release script requires several external command line tools:"
+echo " - git"
+echo " - mvn"
+echo " - hub (https://hub.github.com/)"

replies.bodyText: Or is the benefit of using hub that we don’t have to log in again?
replies.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText: Btw. We need to test that hub (or whatever we end up with) works as an early step in the script. So it doesn’t crash half way through.
replies.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText: I wasn't aware there was another client, I thought hub is the official client. Happy to consider alternatives if they're better.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText:
Or is the benefit of using hub that we don’t have to log in again?

No and actually that brings up a point: you need to set this tool up first before it works.
